Simple and elegant, I liked it :)
Pretty close to posterous?

Been using Pen.io since it was on Hacker News a week or so ago. I love it, it's nothing like posterous, it can be a way to send your pitch to people, a twitlonger alternative or what ever you want it to be.
Anthony Feint from Pen.io here.   In response to a couple of questions.  Pen.io fully supports HTML, the additional markup such as the :page is designed to do what HTML can't.
@faheem there is no login.  User flow is designed this way to give the user a more permanent feel to the page as opposed to a pastebin type app

@feint I was thinking along the lines of giving [new] users immediate access to the text editor without having to go through the frustration of trying to think of a good page name first, given that, as the service gains popularity the preferred name of choice could very well be taken already. It may even take several tries before the author can start writing.

So by giving the user immediate access it allows them to begin their writing process actually writing, the focus being on the content itself right from the get go, page names and passwords should always be an afterthought for the author. Having said that, now that you've explained it I can appreciate the logic behind the current flow, more so because it seems you guys have actually thought about it.

Sorry for the rather long reply, I could have very well used pen.io for this :P 

Wish you guys good luck

@feint have you considered adding a "floating" toolbar at the bottom of the page that would have buttons to insert and/or modify the pages?  Then the ":page" markup would not be required ... a basic user would simply click a button at the bottom.  You could then add other "Edit" and "Save" buttons down there also ...
Pitch is here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_detailpage&v=YmLHb351oV4#t=1508s
@feint was awesome to meet you at Launch.  Can't wait to see what's next  :)
nice meeting you at launch. simple, awesome idea.
I think they can do more on design. Coz a friend of mine asking me is there any beautiful website when you just enter a text
@Humancell yes.  Currently working on an improved editor atm.
Just thinking about this, making it a plug in that would work for anyone's site with a "powered by pen.io" at the bottom would open up the page grab problem and probably be a revenue stream.
pen.io rocks. would be cool if there was a simple "voting" widget so one could collect feedback. I'd pay for that
